channel.title: Locked out!
channel.description:
Alright, we got a used computer blah blah blah... well, it was working fine, until my mom got on and set her account to admin, and my account to limited... Well, the problem with that is, her ACCOUNT NEVER SHOWED UP! It doesn't show up on the log-in screen, and doing it through the Classic log-in menu won't work either..
I've tried: classic log-in screen, using safe mode, using the admin account. The admin account has a password on it, and the hint is "JLE spelled out". I assume that is the owner's name, which I know is Jason (from files on the computer).
Could anyone help me please?

item.title: Locked out!
item.dc:creator: @crashe crashe
item.description:
@crashe wrote:

Got it. I downloaded a .iso and burned it to a CD, then booted with that. Some confusing DOS prompts and simple commands later, I was in the Admin account.

Thanks for the tips guys (and gals…)!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out!
item.dc:creator: @crashe crashe
item.description:
@crashe wrote:

Eh… problem is, my mom got this at the PTA Thrift Shop… She’s a sucker for a good deal… eh, that’s beside the point. We don’t know WHO this Jason dude is…

And, about the computer. It was like 30 bucks, and it has XP w/ SP2, a wireless card… that right there is a good deal. Also, low (192mb) RAM, but has a CD RW… Eh… anyways, a keylogger wouldn’t work. Ergh…

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Hmm, try using kane’s keylogger. Let Jason put in the username and pass, and it will get logged and then check back in a day or so and you should have the pass when looking through the logs.

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out!
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Err, just ask Jason for the pass? =/

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out!
item.dc:creator: @crashe crashe
item.description:
@crashe wrote:

Eh, good effort, Rictoo. Buuuut… that didn’t quite work out. I’m not allowed to write to the registry… GAH!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out!
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Method 2 - Manual registry edit

Click Start, Run and type Regedit.exe

Navigate to the following key:

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE \ SOFTWARE \ Microsoft \ Windows NT \ CurrentVersion \ Winlogon \ SpecialAccounts \ UserList

Use the File, Export option to backup the key.

Right-click in the right pane and select New DWORD Value.

Type-in Administrator(Jason) as the value.

Double-click Administrator(Jason), and assign a value of 1

Close Regedit

You may use this procedure to hide/show users in the Welcome Screen for any user account. Type the account name accordingly in step 5.

Taken from: http://windowsxp.mvps.org/admins.htm

Good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out!
item.dc:creator: @crashe crashe
item.description:
@crashe wrote:

Correction, it’s “JIL” spelled out. And I just looked at the system info, and the computer is registered to “James Glenn” This makes no sense…

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out!
item.dc:creator: @crashe crashe
item.description:
@crashe wrote:

I’ve tried those… as well as: jayelleee, jayellee, jayelee, jayeleee, jay ell ee, jay ell eee… just random variations on it. Nothing worked! Aye aye aye…

I was thinking about making a recovery disk on my personal computer (XP Media Center), and “recovering” them onto this computer… Would that work?

Read full topic

item.title: Locked out!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

try jayelee, or jayele, or jayalee, or jayale.

Read full topic
